summary:
Graduated with a Bachelor of Business Administration from Hotel Management School in Maastricht, I take the next step in hospitality.

I am people oriented and hospitality is a passion for me. Making the guest feel at home, being an inspiration is what I strive for. I am a perfectionist and motivated person. My working experience as an intern at The Standard Spa, Miami Beach, FL, USA was the perfect start to my career in hospitality. As a supervisor in housekeeping, I got to work on my leadership skills, being at the head of a team of twenty, together with two managers. I had to work under time-pressure and quickly learn to communicate in Spanish. As a front desk agent, I was representative of the hotel and was responsible of providing the guests the best introduction to a great experience. Overall, this unique journey has given me insights into the organization and different management levels of a hotel.

Moreover, my internship for Hilton The Netherlands cluster sales office has deepened my administrative and managerial skills. I have learned to work in a very fast-paced environment with a lot of responsibilities. As a sales coordinator trainee, I have learned to work with Excel to prepare key reports, corporate contracts, but also to work on long-term projects, necessary in today's competitive hospitality industry. This internship has provided me with a deeper understanding of key strategies and activities implemented at a cluster sales level.

I am a team player, proactive, with high organizational skills and a great sense of personal responsibility. My flexibility and adaptability have proven in the past that I integrate rapidly in a new work environment. I have learned to take the lead and delegate tasks, while remaining a team player and respecting authority.

education.degree_name: Bachelor of English Language, Literature and Civilization
Baccalauréat Littéraire - Speciality in English Language

projects.title: Hilton Car Rally Benelux 2017
projects.description:
The Hilton Car rally Benelux is an event prepared by the sales departments, marketing department and Hilton Worlwide Sales department for key MICE and events bookers. It is a client appreciation event that serves to showcase the Hilton properties in the Netherlands and create a unique memorable experience. The project management team of the Hilton Car Rally worked during five months on the preparation of the event.
I had a supportive role in the preparation of the event: keeping the guest list up-to-date, arranging transport for the guests to the event, welcoming the guests at the event and coordinating the departure of the guests from the start location in The Hague to the end location in Antwerp.

projects.title: PUZZLED: Creation of a new business model
projects.description: In a team of five, I worked on the development and research of ‘PUZZLED’, an innovative lounge bar targeted at students and young professionals of the Maastricht area. The bar is intended to meet the needs and wants of today’s student. At the end, the business concept was presented to a jury of entrepreneurs.

contributors.headline: Adviseur Zorgverkoop bij 's Heeren Loo | MSc Healthcare Management
Graduate of the Hotel Management School Maastricht

projects.title: Advisory Report Hotel Brull
projects.description: Worked as a Junior Consultant in a team of six for Hotel Brull, a 26 room hotel recently added to the portfolio of Saillant Hotel Group. In view of this management transition, the project group was responsible for preparing an advisory report. This advice included a marketing plan, a review of the implementation of a revenue management system, a definition of a strategic concept and design for the property, and finally, a valuation of the property and its future potential. This project was part of the curriculum for the minor ‘Revenue Management and Real Estate Management’.

contributors.headline: Product Manager Websites at OpenUp & iPractice

projects.title: Consultancy Report Courtyard by Marriott Berlin-Mitte
projects.description: Worked as a Junior Consultant in a team of six for Courtyard by Marriott, a 4-star hotel located in Berlin with a focus on business travellers. During 20 weeks, we conducted research and created an innovative concept for the hotel to attract more guests and improve the service for guests. This project was part of the curriculum at the HMSM for year 3 ‘Strategic Management Planning’.

contributors.headline: Customer Experience - Porsche Netherlands | Owner - Sprekersbureau De Jonge Sprekers
Graduate of the Hotel Management School Maastricht

projects.title: Gastronomic Event
projects.description: Responsible for the decoration of the location and the organization of the event. Hosted the event.

contributors.headline: Senior Recruitment Coordinator @ Abrivia | Multilingual Recruitment
希尔顿全球酒店集团 - Cluster Revenue Manager

profile_positions.description: Assisted the hotel manager in the daily tasks of running the hotel, while also completing reception shifts. Helped in hiring, training and motivating qualified employees for the reception, HSK and maintenance, with the support of HR to complete their enrollment process. Daily communication with the hotel manager and teams to ensure guests expectations are met to the Gr8 standards and successful day to day operation of the hotel. Created key reports for head office in Oosterhout, and corporate contracts for businesses. Inventory and order of supplies for the hotel. Assisted the hotel manager in handling hotel bills and guest reviews. During the time at Gr8 hotels, obtained the BHV, SVH social hygiene and Leermeester diplomas.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Hotel Manager

profile_positions.description:
Two-phased process: In a first time, assisted in the opening phase of the new Gr8 Hotel at Maastricht Aachen Airport. Assisted the Guest Relations Officer in interviewing and selecting the reception, housekeeping and maintenance teams. Prepared the hotel for the opening stage in the last phase of the build: furnishing, cleaning, preparing and inspecting the 114 rooms and common areas to be ready to welcome the first guests. At the same time, orientated, trained and motivated the reception and housekeeping teams to the Gr8 standards together with the GRO and Gr8 teams.
In a second time, actual opening of the hotel. Welcomed the first guests, during covid. Prepared guest arrivals with special requests and arrangements. Supported guests in handling the check-in process through the technology of kiosks. Completed guest registrations, departures and billing in Amadeus PMS. Provided touristic information and handled reservations with the assistance of the reservations team. Promoted upselling and cross-selling. Handled possible complaints, expected during the opening stage. Daily task of maintaining the reception and common areas clean and tidy.
profile_positions.title: Teamleader Reception

profile_positions.description: Responsible for guests registration and departures, introducing new guests to the world of IHG and enrolling them into IHG Rewards Club. Provided touristic information on the area. Operated incoming phone calls. Handled guests complaints using guest recovery method. Daily administrative tasks of cashier closure, room plans, billing, lost and found. Maximized sales revenues through upselling, cross-selling. Supported the reservations office with taking in reservations, promotion of arrangements, Holidex, Booking.com and Expedia guests messages.
profile_positions.title: Front Desk Agent

profile_positions.description: Responsible for the preparation and production of key reports to support the work of the sales managers. Administrative role of production of corporate contracts, production overviews, account rate loadings in cooperation with Hilton Area Rate Team. Flexible position, working three days a week from the different properties of the cluster (Amsterdam, Amsterdam Schiphol, The Hague) to best assist the sales managers in their work and projects, and two days a week from the cluster office in Rotterdam.
profile_positions.title: Cluster Assistant Sales Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
• HOUSEKEEPING SUPERVISOR (February – April)
Responsible for the cleanliness of all 105 rooms and their readiness for turnover to Front Desk. Essential role of coordination of the work of all houseladies and housemen, keeping track of the time and that the rooms on queue were cleaned in priority. Keeping staff motivated to achieve the highest quality standards everyday, given the amount of time and the conditions of the rooms. Handled all communications in Spanish in a team of two managers, nine houseladies and eight housemen and three minibar attendants.

• FRONT DESK AGENT (April – July)
Responsible for providing the guests the best introduction to a great experience. Responsible for being a person of trust for the guests throughout their stay and insuring a warm presence at the desk at all times. Handled guest registrations and departures, as well as guest payments using OPERA. Maximized sales revenues through upselling. Operated switchboard and directed calls professionally and in a friendly manner. Handled guest complaints with care.
profile_positions.title: Rooms Division Intern

profile_positions.description:
Different experiences in service such as for the presentation of the new 2014 Michelin guide stars or the opening of the United World College by King Willem-Alexander of the Netherlands.

• Responsible for looking after the guests and attending to their needs during the events.
• Laying, preparing and setting tables to high standards.
• Served drinks and dishes to customers to the standards required.
• Answered guest queries in a polite and helpful manner.
profile_positions.title: Waitress

profile_positions.description:
Assisting the chef and other kitchen staff with the preparation of hot and cold foods whilst following and implementing all health and safety regulations. Providing food for up to 60 guests. Restaurant L' Étoile, Teaching Hotel Chateau Bethlehem.

• Prepared, cooked and arranged plates for guests.
• Kept the working area and kitchen clean and tidy.
• Assisted in stock control, portion control and quality control.
• Time-management and working under time pressure.
profile_positions.title: Sous Chef

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for looking after the guests and attending to their needs during their visit. Welcoming them to the restaurant, escorting them to their table and informing them about the menu.

• Provided a warm welcome to customers.
• Received food and drinks orders and served guests according to the standards required.
• Ensured timely delivery of all food and beverage items to customers.
• Presented the menu to the guests.
• Made wine recommendations.
• Upsold wines and other menu items.
• Answered guest queries in a polite and helpful manner.
• Good communication with kitchen staff.
• Checked on guests and asked if they are enjoying their meals and services.
• Looked after guests with special needs i.e. dietary requirements, allergies.
profile_positions.title: Waitress

profile_positions.description:
Handled the smooth running of the bar to deliver high standard of service and customer satisfaction. Provided a visible presence to ensure that all customer requests and queries were responded to promptly and effectively.

• Served guests from behind the bar, offering advice and information on drinks.
• Responsible for keeping the bar clean and tidy, collecting empty glasses and cleaning them.
• Prepared the bar for service, restocking drinks.
• Operated cash and credit card payments.
• Provided a professional, friendly and courteous service to all customers.
profile_positions.title: Bar Staff

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for providing a friendly welcome and high-quality service over the phone to guests arriving at the hotel. Constantly portraying a highly professional image of the hotel. Paying particular attention to guest satisfaction in a 26 rooms hotel with high service values.

• Took reservations over the phone and by email for the hotel and restaurant.
• Welcomed guests to the hotel in a polite, friendly and helpful manner.
• Handled guest registration and departures, as well as room assignments.
• Gave guests details about the rooms and informed on the hotel concept.
• Check-in and check-out of hotel guests using the hotel’s accounting system.
• Kept guests’ files up to date.
• Took payment from guests in the form of cash or credit cards.
• Arranged brief tours of the hotel rooms and facilities, talked about the design of the rooms.
• Operated switchboard and directed calls professionally, promptly and appropriately.
• Maximized sales revenues through cross selling of the restaurant.
• Dealt with guests’ complaints.
• Ensured all relevant paperwork had been completed in order for a smooth hand-over at the end of the shift.
• Was a point of contact for guests should they have any queries.
profile_positions.title: Front Desk Agent

profile_positions.description:
Ensuring the cleaning of rooms and common areas in a design hotel according to standards. All rooms required different cleaning methods due to their different design. Worked in a team, under time pressure.

• Swept, mopped, dusted furniture, windows, floors, furnishings, equipment.
• Made beds according to standards.
• Kept bathroom supplied with paper, towels and soap.
• Collected and disposed of waste and garbage.
• Maintained inventory.
• Worked upon special room requests.
• Time-management.
profile_positions.title: Housekeeper

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for creating a good working atmosphere, leading, co-ordinating and motivating the kitchen staff. Making sure all procedures involved in the kitchen were in accordance with Health and Food Safety standards.

• Delegated responsibilities, organized people and tasks
• Supervised others.
• Menu planning (lunch and dinner).
• In charge of the cooking, preparation and serving of meals on time.
• Kept the kitchen organised, ensured utensils were placed in the correct place.
• Checked food items on delivery and tidied them into cold storage and inventory.
profile_positions.title: Shiftleader

profile_positions.description: Responsible for the complete translation of a Dutch-owned website from English to French.
profile_positions.title: Translator

profile_positions.description: Assisted a young cook in her planning, cooking and mise-en-place for several birthday parties, up to 80 guests.
profile_positions.title: Assistant for a freelance caterer

volunteer_experiences.description: Family startup. Participative role in the social media presence and at fairs and events. Inventory organization of the webshop.
Responsible for the table ‘French’, supporting students from the HMSM in their French Language skills, one hour every week. As part of a community involvement project.
Helped children after school time to do their homework. As part of a humanity involvement project.
